channel.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
channel.description:
This happened in Argentina, it was in hands of an engineer and were stole by a hacker in 1996, he found the file now 'cause he couldn't decrypt it back in those times(and even today) and were in an old Hard Disk. The coding is very interesting and weird for those times. You can check the file and try to decrypt it if you're an old programmer, but maybe it'll cost much more than it looks.
Check the file out: [url]https://newserverclear.site90.com/polybius/POLYBIUSDUMPBCK.7z[/url]
And check the post in an Argentinian website.
[url]https://www.taringa.net/posts/juegos/9932721/Primera-parte_-Al-fin-la-verdad___-Polybius.html[/url]
I post this because it looked very... VERY interesting and extremely consistent history. This file will go over the world, i'm sure of it.

item.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
item.dc:creator: SwampFox
item.description:
Zen609:

@Patrick

Like I said before - the guy is lying. His explanation is a bunch of bullshit to save his story.

7z isn’t a compression algorithm, it’s the archive format native to 7-zip - native to 7-zip - native to 7-zip.

https://www.7-zip.org/7z.html

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7z

The main features of 7z format:

Open architecture
High compression ratio
Strong AES-256 encryption
Ability of using any compression, conversion or encryption method
Supporting files with sizes up to 16000000000 GB
Unicode file names
Solid compressing
Archive headers compressing

High compression ratio

[COLOR=‘red’]compression

:hmph:

Read full topic
item.source: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.

item.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
item.dc:creator: kiuth
item.description:
I guess it’s all bullshit then. Too sad, that story made my day. Anyway thousands of people fell off on that shit. Today they closed the comments in that post(too many curses xD).

It looked interesting and(I admit it) I believed in that story 'cause of my ignorance, but wasn’t sure until i posted here and discover what kind of bullshit it’s.

PD : The guy posted that he get laid a lot, is that a lie too? Maybe… Maybe…
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

407×521 23.7 KB

item.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Maxey:

I have no idea what this thread is about.

Could someone explain what’s this polybius business in a nutshell?

It’s a myth. Videogame designed specifically to control children’s minds and force them to commit suicide and shit like that.

All bullshit. It was from an anti videogame propaganda campaign. Back when their lies still had some class.

item.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
item.dc:creator: SwampFox
item.description:
Zen609:

You can google ‘polybius’ for the story. It’s an old urban myth from usenet. Taringa is a link dump site. I’m familiar with it. A guy posted a link to this file on Taringa.

The poster tells this big, long, irrelevant story about how he came across the file in 1996. The file he downloaded from some random guy in 1996 was POLYBIUSDUMPBCK.7z. There was no such extension in 1996. That’s why I posted the link to the 7-ZIP history.

The guy is a dumbass. If you’re gonna pull a hoax, it should at least be plausible for more than a few paragraphs. The rest of the post is another big, long, irrelevant story as to why he has only just revealed the file now. At the end, he posts the link to the file.

It’s all a bunch of bullshit, and he’s a lame hoaxter - fucking amateur.

EDIT: I read some of the comments on Taringa, someone pointed out the 7z extension (scroll way down). The OP’s response was something about how the 7z format existed long before and independent of 7-ZIP. That’s complete bullshit - the 7z format is native to 7-ZIP, which was released in 1999.

After reading a few of OPs responses to comments, this seems less like a classic hoax and more like a personal attention-seeking kinda thing.

  1. The issue and 7z 7zip.
    One of the major attacks or excuses that have my detractors to show that there is a trout after my post is that the 7zip format (which compresses the ROM) is 1999, which, my history to have found it in 1996 would be false. Here we go:
    This if I have arto; to see Come again, The 7z format is a compression format, similar to what is the zip or rar. 7zip is asoftware created by Igor Pavlov in 1999 used LZMA algorithms (which is 98 ) and PPMD ​​(that’s 1991, born jurisdiction of zip used by programmers primarily for its ability to compress text (which incidentally is excellent))
    Despite this, nowadays, you usually 7zip reports the LZMA compression format is because it is used to decompress PPMD ​​too.
    Anyway, the 7z is the algorithm that encodes the actions of PPMD, ie a form of compression used 7z.
    7zip is a visual environment 7z (A GUI) as it is the RAR WINRAR (notice but believe me, that the route installation of WINRAR C rogram rar.exe FilesWinRAR this file is the command line.
    It may be that no one has understood?? For more information onMagazine PC lusers (do not leave me here in Taringa put the real name, so I take the L ok?) In the first edition which came gift floppies, appears as an option 7z compression (at that time, there were options today Today everyone uses rar, zip, or 7zip)
    From last, if everything is an invention, I would send such a shit? Do not believe the care you use to assemble the storygo to put a format old as zip, rar, or pk ??? Think!

:hmph:

Read full topic

Have at it.

item.title: Allegedly first and original DUMP of POLYBIUS found.
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
blackout:

someone wanna describe what this is?

You can google ‘polybius’ for the story. It’s an old urban myth from usenet. Taringa is a link dump site. I’m familiar with it. A guy posted a link to this file on Taringa.

The poster tells this big, long, irrelevant story about how he came across the file in 1996. The file he downloaded from some random guy in 1996 was POLYBIUSDUMPBCK.7z. There was no such extension in 1996. That’s why I posted the link to the 7-ZIP history.

The guy is a dumbass. If you’re gonna pull a hoax, it should at least be plausible for more than a few paragraphs. The rest of the post is another big, long, irrelevant story as to why he has only just revealed the file now. At the end, he posts the link to the file.

It’s all a bunch of bullshit, and he’s a lame hoaxter - fucking amateur.

EDIT: I read some of the comments on Taringa, someone pointed out the 7z extension (scroll way down). The OP’s response was something about how the 7z format existed long before and independent of 7-ZIP. That’s complete bullshit - the 7z format is native to 7-ZIP, which was released in 1999.

After reading a few of OPs responses to comments, this seems less like a classic hoax and more like a personal attention-seeking kinda thing.

Read full topic
